creator: ryos@ix.netcom.com
text:
In Web Test controller, when I specify it to use parameter and give it some 
parameter, but leave the last parameter without any value and the particular 
parameter doesn't get sent.

steps:
1. Open JMeter, create ThreadGroup
2. Add Generative Controller >> Web Testing
3. Go into the Web Testing configuration. Fill out usual stuff
4. Check Parameter Name checkbox and add a new Parameter, fill just the name 
and leave the value side blank. (in real world, this happens often, because the 
last parameter usually comes from the web form submit button, where unless user 
specifies the label, the value is blank)

Result: The particular parameter doesn't get submitted with the request.

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
Ok, I suspect the problem here is actually a problem with the Table in the 
Parameter gui.  Often, the last item entered doesn't register with JMeter (ie, 
you type in the last value, and then go to your mouse and move on to the next 
thing).  To get your last table entry to register, hit the "Enter" key after 
typing in your value.  I suspect that JMeter will send paramters that have "" 
as their value, but since the name of the parameter didn't register, jmeter is 
sending a blank for the whole thing.

In short, hit Enter after every value you type into that table.  I know how to 
fix this, but it's tedious, and I'll get to it later.

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text: *** Bug 6742 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 8530 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: mstover1@apache.org
jsalvata@atg.com
text:
Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.
Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
